benchmark_details.name: MME VALPRO
benchmark_details.overview: MME VALPRO is a multimodal benchmark designed to avoid Type-I errors in evaluating Large Multimodal Models (LMMs) through a trilogy evaluation pipeline, consisting of an original question, a perception question, and a knowledge anchor question. It demonstrates a more accurate reflection of LMM capabilities and fosters trustworthiness in evaluations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To address issues in existing multimodal evaluation benchmarks and provide a more rigorous and trustworthy assessment of large multimodal models.

data.source: MMMU (validation set), ScienceQA (image subset), MathVista (test mini set)
data.annotation: Questions were manually labeled by human experts and sourced from existing benchmarks.

methodology.calculation: Genuine Accuracy is determined by whether the model answers the original question and both corresponding perception and knowledge questions correctly.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Genuine Accuracy indicates better true understanding of multimodal capabilities.
methodology.validation: The dataset was evaluated by graduate students, and a double-checking process was performed by independent reviewers.
